content.text:
[@dominic](@EMovhfIrFk4NihAKnRNhrfRaqIhBv1Wj8pTxJNgvCCY=.ed25519) 

That's the second or third time I've done that, too. The other one is that I don't use shift with name suggestions so even though I identify him as [@Dan Hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) on SSB the autosuggest still writes [@dan hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) .

[@Dan Hassan](@NeB4q4Hy9IiMxs5L08oevEhivxW+/aDu/s/0SkNayi0=.ed25519) 

Just to clarify, you don't mean that people can see who I'm talking to, do you? I know that others can see *when* I post a private message but I'd be surprised to find that they know *who* the message is to.
